metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2018 Conference on Computational Linguistics
Affiliations: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
Dicta: The Israel Center for Text Analysis
metadata.Abstract: Arabic is a widely-spoken language with a rich and long history spanning more than fourteen centuries. We develop a large-scale, historical corpus of Arabic of about 1 billion words from diverse periods of time. We clean this corpus, process it with a morphological analyzer, and enhance it by detecting parallel passages and automatically dating undated texts. We demonstrate its utility with selected case-studies in which we show its application to the digital humanities.
